title: Can prolonged stress and depression actually damage the brain? Could the damage impair someone's mental functioning? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a current theory of the neurobiology of major depressive disorder (MDD) (with a lot of evidence backing it up) which suggests that chronic stress causes neuronal death in the hippocampus which then leads to MDD.  Here is an article about this: Chronic depression shrinks brain's memories and emotions The causal relationship (that is: whether the decrease in hippocampal size causes MDD or the other way around, or there is some third factor involved that influences both the size of the hippocampus and the disease) is still a little unclear, but the evidence of a relationship is there and is quit strong. The hippocampus is strongly implicated in memory function and one would assume that a decrease in hippocampal volume would affect memory in some way. In fact those with MDD do show cognitive and memory deficits.
